title: Celastrus tree

properties.name: description
properties.value: A Celastrus tree is a high-level tree that can be grown with the Farming skill. Players with at least level 85 Farming may plant a celastrus sapling in the high-tier area of the Farming Guild. The nearby farmer can be paid 8 potato cacti to protect a planted celastrus tree from becoming diseased. Due to the long grow time, high cost of the celastrus seeds, and the relatively low cost of potato cactus, it is recommended to pay the farmer for protection.

A Celastrus tree is a high-level tree that can be grown with the Farming skill. Players with at least level 85 Farming may plant a celastrus sapling in the high-tier area of the Farming Guild. The nearby farmer can be paid 8 potato cacti to protect a planted celastrus tree from becoming diseased. Due to the long grow time, high cost of the celastrus seeds, and the relatively low cost of potato cactus, it is recommended to pay the farmer for protection.

Celastrus trees are grown by first planting a celastrus seed in a filled plant pot, which will turn into a celastrus sapling after being watered and allowed to grow. The celastrus sapling is then planted in the celastrus patch using a spade. Currently, the advanced tier of the Farming Guild holds the location of the only celastrus patch.

An amulet of nature can be bound to the patch to provide players with information about its growing progress. Once fully grown, the tree produces celastrus bark and will grant 14,130 exp on health check. This yield can be improved by composting the patch before it is fully grown,[1] having Magic secateurs equipped,[2] and having an Attas seed planted.[3]

The celastrus tree may be chopped. The tree provides no logs, but instead grants 23.5 Farming experience for each piece of Celastrus bark harvested. Once all of the bark has been harvested, the tree will become depleted. Unlike other trees grown in farming patches which regenerate or produce more fruit, the celastrus tree does not regrow bark, but remains in a "harvested" state. The fully harvested celastrus tree may then be cut down and cleared using a spade, preparing the patch to grow another tree.

Growing a celastrus tree, harvesting the Celastrus bark, and using a knife to create a Battlestaff is required for a Kourend & Kebos Elite Diary task.

Contents

  • 1 Farming info
  • 2 Growth stages
  • 3 Trivia
  • 4 References

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Celastrus, in real life, are a genus of shrubs and vines commonly known as staff vines or staff trees.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 24 January 2019. (Archived from the original on 28 May 2020.) Mod Ash: "Yes, celastrus would be helped by composting."
  2. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 05 February 2019. (Archived from the original on 28 May 2020.) Mod Ash: "I can't offer to go read the code for you from here, but I think so."
  3. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 15 April 2020. (Archived from the original on 28 May 2020.) Mod Ash: "Yes, that effect is tied into the core of harvesting where it does indeed affect Celastrus."

A '''Celastrus tree''' is a high-level tree that can be grown with the [[Farming]] skill. Players with at least level 85 Farming may plant a [[celastrus sapling]] in the high-tier area of the [[Farming Guild]]. The nearby farmer can be paid 8 [[potato cacti]] to protect a planted celastrus tree from becoming [[Disease (Farming)|diseased]]. Due to the long grow time, high cost of the celastrus seeds, and the relatively low cost of [[potato cactus]], it is recommended to pay the farmer for protection.

Celastrus trees are grown by first planting a [[celastrus seed]] in a [[filled plant pot]], which will turn into a [[celastrus sapling]] after being watered and allowed to grow. The celastrus sapling is then planted in the [[celastrus patch]] using a spade. Currently, the advanced tier of the Farming Guild holds the location of the only celastrus patch.

An [[amulet of nature]] can be bound to the patch to provide players with information about its growing progress. Once fully grown, the tree produces [[celastrus bark]] and will grant 14,130 exp on health check. This yield can be improved by composting the patch before it is fully grown,{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/1088630402284224512|date=24 January 2019|archiveurl=https://archive.is/LeHQ1|archivedate=28 May 2020|quote=Yes, celastrus would be helped by composting.}} having [[Magic secateurs]] equipped,{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/1092832728830095360|date=05 February 2019|archiveurl=https://archive.is/2Ptfb|archivedate=28 May 2020|quote=I can't offer to go read the code for you from here, but I think so.}} and having an [[Attas seed]] planted.{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/1250487359730302978|date=15 April 2020|archiveurl=https://archive.is/gGNsy|archivedate=28 May 2020|quote=Yes, that effect is tied into the core of harvesting where it does indeed affect Celastrus.}}

The celastrus tree may be chopped. The tree provides no logs, but instead grants 23.5 Farming experience for each piece of [[Celastrus bark]] harvested. Once all of the bark has been harvested, the tree will become depleted. Unlike other trees grown in farming patches which regenerate or produce more fruit, the celastrus tree does not regrow bark, but remains in a "harvested" state. The fully harvested celastrus tree may then be cut down and cleared using a spade, preparing the patch to grow another tree.

Growing a celastrus tree, harvesting the [[Celastrus bark]], and using a knife to create a [[Battlestaff]] is required for a [[Kourend & Kebos Diary|Kourend & Kebos Elite Diary]] task.
